derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: from Hindi pakkā 'cooked, ripe, substantial'

entry.def: If you describe something or someone as pukka, you mean that they are real or genuine, and of good quality.

sentences.sentence: "pukka quarters with a swarm of servants"

auth_sentence.content: Pukka members of the white Establishment.
